Line 39: Line 39:
The incident led to further protests and calls for the resignation of Chancellor [[Linda P.B. Katehi]]. On November 19, Katehi called for creation of a task force to review the incident and report their findings and recommendations within 90 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/r/29813746/detail.html|title=Task Force Created To Review Pepper Spray Incident|publisher=KCRA-TV|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref>
The incident led to further protests and calls for the resignation of Chancellor [[Linda P.B. Katehi]]. On November 19, Katehi called for creation of a task force to review the incident and report their findings and recommendations within 90 days.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kcra.com/r/29813746/detail.html|title=Task Force Created To Review Pepper Spray Incident|publisher=KCRA-TV|accessdate=2011-11-19}}</ref>
â
==Response==
+
===Response===
[[Laura Flanders]] described the events as a "[[Bull Connor]] Moment", in reference to the Birmingham, Alabama leader who infamously deployed firehoses and attack dogs against peaceful protestors during the [[American Civil Rights Movement]].<ref>[http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/amex/eyesontheprize/story/07_c.html PBS's Eyes on the Prize segment, including video of Connor.][http://www2.nbc13.com/vtm/news/local/article/bull_connors_tank_returns_to_birmingham/39865/ Connor's Tank Returns to Birmingham]; Laura Flanders, Nov 19, 2011 "Up with Chris Hayes"</ref> University Professor [[Bob Ostertag]] echoed these sentiments in public letter, writing:<ref>[[Bob Ostertag]]. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/bob-ostertag/uc-davis-protest_b_1103039.html Militarization of Campus Police], ''[[Huffington Post]]''</ref>
[[Laura Flanders]] described the events as a "[[Bull Connor]] Moment", in reference to the Birmingham, Alabama leader who infamously deployed firehoses and attack dogs against peaceful protestors during the [[American Civil Rights Movement]].<ref>[http://www.pbs.org/wgbh/amex/eyesontheprize/story/07_c.html PBS's Eyes on the Prize segment, including video of Connor.][http://www2.nbc13.com/vtm/news/local/article/bull_connors_tank_returns_to_birmingham/39865/ Connor's Tank Returns to Birmingham]; Laura Flanders, Nov 19, 2011 "Up with Chris Hayes"</ref> University Professor [[Bob Ostertag]] echoed these sentiments in public letter, writing:<ref>[[Bob Ostertag]]. [http://www.huffingtonpost.com/bob-ostertag/uc-davis-protest_b_1103039.html Militarization of Campus Police], ''[[Huffington Post]]''</ref>
{{quote|"Chancellor Robert Birgeneau thus joins the likes of Bull Connor, the notorious segregationist and architect of the violent repression of the civil rights movement in Birmingham, Alabama, as some of the very few people who view the non-violent tactics of Martin Luther King as violent." }}
{{quote|"Chancellor Robert Birgeneau thus joins the likes of Bull Connor, the notorious segregationist and architect of the violent repression of the civil rights movement in Birmingham, Alabama, as some of the very few people who view the non-violent tactics of Martin Luther King as violent." }}
